div.p:
S/Sgt Ann Smitth
A-700-158 - WAC DeT
Hunter Field GA

Mrs. G. W. Carlstead
431 Alleghany
Vallejo
California

They will never go hungry. I just
weight 150 lbs. now. Soon will be
ready to butcher. I don't care how
much I weaight as long as I feel good.
How are the boys + what are
they doing? I sure wish I could
see them.
Well I guess I had better get
to work because I have to go to
town this afternoon for the laundry
shos + dry cleaning. Write often.

Received your letter yesterday
with the cartoons. The kids get a
big kick out of them. Things like
that always go the rounds. Am sending
you a sample of poems. I think they
are cute. I just have two cards now.
I think I have thrown all the
others away. I had one from North
Africa + also one from England. But
Can't seem to find them this a.m.
The next letter I get from them I'll
send save and send to you
(over)

I'll never get into trouble getting things
for G. W. I get them at classification
warehouses. I'll see what I can do
about shirts. What size does he wear?
Sunday night will be the formal opening
of our day room. Thursday is
Thanksgiving and we have invited all
200 soldiers that are living in the
city to come over + have dinner.
I don't know what we will do Xmas.
I am invited over to Q.M. (Quartermaster)
Co. to eat Dinner Thanksgiving + Xmas.
So it looks as if I'll get plenty to
eat. That is sure one thing I can
say. We always have plenty to eat.
This morning we had toast, eggs,
grapefruit, breakfast food. coffee. jelly
for breakfast. Heaving fried chicken
for dinner because I know for I
have already been over to the mess
hall for a chicken leg. If a person
stays on the good side of the cooks
